intro: Opophytum dactylinum, commonly known as the velvetleaf or velvetleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to violet. The plant is often found in disturbed areas, such as roadsides and abandoned fields, due to its adaptability. Opophytum dactylinum is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many climbing and trailing plants. Its rapid growth and ability to spread through seeds make it both a useful ornamental plant and a potential weed.
